clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of the InPress Device in Treating Primary Postpartum Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Single Arm Pivotal Clinical Trial Designed to Assess the Safety and Performance of the InPress Device in Treating Primary Postpartum Hemorrhage

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the InPress Device in the control and reduction of primary postpartum hemorrhage.

detailed_description.textblock: This IDE study is designed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of the InPress Device to treat primary PPH. The study in literature controlled.

primary_outcome.description: Control of postpartum hemorrhage, defined as the avoidance of non-surgical, second-line or surgical intervention to control uterine hemorrhage after the use of the InPress Device per the Instructions for Use

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and intensity of device-related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Incidence and intensity of device-related Adverse Events will be documented during the course of the study.

arm_group.description: InPress Device for Postpartum Hemorrhage will be administered to subjects who are diagnosed with postpartum hemorrhage.

intervention.description: It is a teardrop-shaped, soft silicone ring that is placed into the uterus, where gentle suction is applied to cause the uterus to contract and shrink in size, compressing the blood vessels so the bleeding stops.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult Female, 18 years of age or older
2. Able to understand and provide informed consent to participate in the study
3. Recent vaginal or cesarean delivery followed by postpartum hemorrhage
4. Clinical estimate of blood loss within 24 hours after birth per the World Health Organization ("WHO") guidelines for diagnosis of Primary Postpartum Hemorrhage of greater than or equal to 500 ml for vaginal delivery or 1000 ml for a Cesarean delivery
5. Failed first-line intervention of uterotonics and uterine massage/bimanual compression to stop bleeding
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Minor (less than 18 years of age)
2. Unable to understand and provide consent to participate in the study
3. Delivery at a uterus size < 34 weeks
4. For Cesarean section subjects: Cervix < 3 cm dilated at the time of the decision to perform a Cesarean section
5. Loss of 1500 ml or more blood
6. Arterial bleeding requiring surgical exploration or angiographic embolization
7. Cases requiring immediate life-saving hysterectomy
8. Untreated uterine anomaly
9. Ongoing intrauterine pregnancy
10. Retained placenta or placenta delivered incomplete unless the bulk of placenta has been removed, and no further placental tissue can be retrieved by a choice of manual and/or curettage intervention
11. Uterine rupture or dehiscence
12. Uterine inversion (uterine fundus not felt abdominally or is visible in vagina)
13. Subject has undergone balloon therapy for PPH prior to use of the InPress Device.
